Package ragmad.scenes.gamescene

Class Map

java.lang.Object
ragmad.scenes.gamescene.Map
public class Map extends Object
Stores a grid of pixels which identifies our Map. Our world basically.

  • Method Details

    • getTileAt

      public int[] getTileAt​(int mouseX, int mouseY, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Get the exact tile from raster coordinate system.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - x-coordinate of the mouse
      mouseY - y-coordinate of the mouse
      xOffset - how much the scene has moved in x direction
      yOffset - how much the scene has moved in y direction
      Returns:
      exact tile at that location

    • getTilesInColumn

      public int[] getTilesInColumn​(int columnNo)
      Iterate through the object map matrix and get all the tiles in that column. Specifies as well if the tile side that is in the column is the left or right part
      Parameters:
      columnNo - - the column that you want to get the tiles of. Column is half width of a tile, so it can split the tile into left and right.
      Returns:
      - returns an array with the tiles in this pattern [tile1.x, tile1.y, tile1.isLeft ...]

    • findExactTile

      public int[] findExactTile​(int mouseX, int mouseY, int[] tilesInColumn, int firstTileXShiftAtScreen, int firstTileYShiftAtScreenAt0Height, int tileWidth, int tileHeight)
      Find the exact tile in which the mouse is hovering on.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - - The mouseX_to_raster in pixels
      mouseY - - The mouseY_to_raster in pixels
      tilesInColumn - - The column with its tiles. It should be an array looks like this [tile1.x, tile1.y, tile1.left, .......] for other tiles
      firstTileXShiftAtScreen - - The first tile pixel position with respect to the raster. (distance from first tile to the top-left edge of the screen)
      firstTileYShiftAtScreenAt0Height - - The first tile pixel position with respect to the raster. (distance from first tile to the top-left edge of the screen)
      tileWidth - - half the width of the tile
      tileHeight - - half the height of the tile
      Returns:
      [tile.x, tile.y] on the map. Tile can be accessed by these coordinates.

    • tileExists

      public boolean tileExists​(int x, int y)
      Checks if the tile exists
      Parameters:
      x - x co-ordinate of the tile
      y - y co-ordinate of the tile
      Returns:
      boolean if tile exists or not

    • getColumn

      public int getColumn​(int mouseX, int firstTileXShiftAtScreen, int columnWidth)
      Get the column in which the mouse is currently in. each half a tile is a column
      Parameters:
      mouseX - - the Mouse x position
      firstTileXShiftAtScreen - - First tile pixel with the respect to the shift. E.g: it can be -130 pixels from the screen
      columnWidth - - the column width which is half of the tile
      Returns:
      - The column number

    • getColorMap

      public HashMap<Integer,​Tile> getColorMap()

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile​(Integer color)
      Receives an int color and returns tile corresponding to that color.
      Parameters:
      color - int color value
      Returns:
      return tile type
